title: How to Make Face Whitening Mask

steps.title: Find a small bowl.
steps.content: Find a small bowl. You can also use a cup, mug, or teacup. You will be working in small amounts, so any small container will do.

steps.title: Put the ingredients into the bowl.
steps.content: Put the ingredients into the bowl. You will need 1 tablespoon of plain yogurt, 1 tablespoon of honey, and 1 teaspoon of lemon juice.

steps.title: Stir the ingredients with a spoon or fork.
steps.content: Stir the ingredients with a spoon or fork. You want to end up with a smooth, creamy consistency. Make sure that everything is blended in together and that there are no streaks.

steps.title: Spread the mask over your face.
steps.content: Spread the mask over your face. Scoop some of the mask up using your fingers, and spread it onto your face. Use your fingers to spread it over your cheeks, forehead, and jaw. Avoid getting too close to sensitive areas, such as the mouth and eyes.

steps.title: Leave the mask on for 15 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the mask on for 15 minutes. The mask may start to run a little bit. If this happens, lay down on your back, or sit in a chair with your head tilted back.

steps.title: Rinse the mask off with warm water.
steps.content: Rinse the mask off with warm water. Lean over a sink and splash your face with warm water. Gently rub your skin to get the mask off. If your face feels a little bit sticky, use some face wash.

steps.title: Pat your face dry and apply some moisturizer, if necessary.
steps.content: Pat your face dry and apply some moisturizer, if necessary. Honey and yogurt are great at moisturizing skin, but those with sensitive skin may find the lemon juice a little drying. If you happen to have sensitive or dry skin, consider applying some moisturizer. Avoid going out into the sun after wearing this mask. Lemon juice makes your skin extra sensitive to sunlight, and makes it easier for you to get sunburned. You can use this mask three to four times a week.

steps.title: Find a small bowl or cup.
steps.content: Find a small bowl or cup. You will be working in small amounts, so any small-volume container will work.

steps.title: Add the ingredients into the bowl.
steps.content: Add the ingredients into the bowl. You will need 2 tablespoons of rosewater, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon of gram flour. If you have dry, sensitive skin, you can also add 2 tablespoons of milk.

steps.title: Stir the ingredients until you get a thick paste.
steps.content: Stir the ingredients until you get a thick paste. You can use a spoon or fork to do this. If the paste is too thin, add some more flour. If the paste is too thick, add some more rosewater.

steps.title: Spread the mask over your face.
steps.content: Spread the mask over your face. Dip your fingers into the small bowl or cup and scoop some of the mask. Start spreading it across your face. Take care to avoid the sensitive areas around your mouth, nose, and eyes.

steps.title: Leave the mask on for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the mask on for 15 to 20 minutes. The mask may start to drip down your face during this time, so it might be a good idea to lay down or sit in a chair with your head tilted back.

steps.title: Rinse the mask off with cool water.
steps.content: Rinse the mask off with cool water. Lean over the sink and splash your face with cool water. Gently massage your skin to ease off the mask. If there is any residue, you may have to wash your face with some face wash.

steps.title: Pat your face dry with a soft towel.
steps.content: Pat your face dry with a soft towel. You can use this mask up to three times a week. Lemon juice makes your skin extra sensitive to the sun. To avoid getting sunburned, stay out of the sun after using this mask.

steps.title: Find a small bowl for your ingredients.
steps.content: Find a small bowl for your ingredients. If you can't find a small bowl, you can use a cup or teacup instead.

steps.title: Pour the ingredients into the bowl.
steps.content: Pour the ingredients into the bowl. You will need 1 teaspoon turmeric powder, 2 teaspoons rice flour, and 3 tablespoons of plain yogurt. If you can't find rice flour, try garbanzo flour or finely-ground oats. [2] X Research source If you don't have yogurt, try using some milk, cream, or sour cream. [3] X Research source If you decide to use milk or cream, start with 1 tablespoon and add more until you get a paste-like consistency.

steps.title: Stir the ingredients with a spoon or fork.
steps.content: Stir the ingredients with a spoon or fork. You want to end up with a paste-like consistency. If the mask is too thin and watery, add more flour. If the mask is too dry, add more yogurt.

steps.title: Consider covering your shoulders with a towel.
steps.content: Consider covering your shoulders with a towel. Turmeric powder is often used in dying fabric. It won't stain your skin, but it may stain your clothes. To keep this from happening, consider draping a towel across your shoulders and securing it with a clip.

steps.title: Spread the mask over your face.
steps.content: Spread the mask over your face. Dip your fingers into the mask, and spread it across your face. Try to avoid your lips, eyes, and eyebrows. Some of the ingredients in this mask are also used in hair removal.

steps.title: Leave the mask on for three to five minutes.
steps.content: Leave the mask on for three to five minutes. You may want to lie down or sit in a chair with your head tilted back so that the mask doesn't slide off your face.

steps.title: Rinse the mask off with warm water.
steps.content: Rinse the mask off with warm water. Lean over a sink, and splash your face with warm water. Gently massage your skin with your fingers until the mask is rinsed off. If there is any residue, you may need to use some face wash as well.

steps.title: Splash your face with cool water, then pat it dry.
steps.content: Splash your face with cool water, then pat it dry. The cool water will help seal and tighten the pores.
